summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) staff discussing the logistics of picking up a signed 6(e) order from Judge Alison Nathan's chambers. The order pertains to the Epstein case, and the emails coordinate retrieval and distribution of the document.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Judge Nathan signed the 6(e) order related to the Epstein case, and her clerk notified the U.S. Attorney's Office that it was ready for pickup from her chambers.

connections.description: Judge Nathan issued a court order that M requested a copy of, indicating a professional legal relationship within the case proceedings.

events.title: 6(e) Order Signed by Judge Nathan
events.description: Judge Alison Nathan signed a 6(e) order related to the Epstein case, and her clerk notified the U.S. Attorney's Office that it was ready for pickup from her chambers.

events.title: Email Coordination for Order Pickup
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office staff exchanged emails to coordinate picking up the signed 6(e) order from Judge Nathan's chambers and scanning it for distribution to M.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: A 6(e) order related to the Epstein case was signed by Judge Alison Nathan on or before January 31, 2020.
The order was ready for pickup from Judge Nathan's chambers, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in the Epstein case in early 2020.
U.S. Attorney's Office staff coordinated via email to retrieve and distribute the order, highlighting procedural aspects of the case management.
The email chain shows internal communication within the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) regarding court documents.
The document references prior orders and questions about whether a magistrate court order is sufficient, suggesting legal procedural discussions.
